snippet.title: Kutcher went on Jobs' fruitarian diet, landed in the hospital
snippet.description: Ashton Kutcher reveals that he was so desperate to be like the Apple co-founder that he tried Jobs' dietary habits -- to ill effect.

snippet.title: Massachusetts approves bill to ban upskirt pics
snippet.description: After a case that seemed to defy any sense that might be common, the Massachusetts legislature speeds through a bill that would classify upskirt pics as sexual harassment.

snippet.title: Kanye, the new Steve Jobs, gets Jobs-signed Apple mouse
snippet.description: Kim Kardashian, good friend of Steve Wozniak, gives her beau lovely Apple Pro mice signed by Jobs and Woz. They are a Father's Day gift.

snippet.title: GM clothes homeless in extra auto material
snippet.description: By donating unused materials, General Motors lends a helping hand to Detroit's most needy.

snippet.title: 'The Matrix' is back (in your hospital)
snippet.description: There he is, Hugo Weaving as Agent Smith. Several Hugo Weavings weaving their way around a hospital. Welcome to the future -- or the present -- of GE software in a new ad.

snippet.title: Steve Jobs' perfect pitch: The Macintosh launch
snippet.description: guest post Former Apple executive Jean Louis Gass√©e takes a nostalgic look at the Mac's historic launch and promises -- not to be confused with the hard struggle later on the battlefield.

snippet.title: Christian Bale is top choice to play Steve Jobs, says report
snippet.description: He's best known as Batman, but a report suggests Christian Bale is the top contender to take on the role of Steve Jobs in a new biopic.

snippet.title: AT&T, General Motors to sell 4G LTE-connected cars next year
snippet.description: The smart-car wars heat up as AT&T snatches a deal from Verizon Wireless, which has long been a partner with GM's OnStar unit.

snippet.title: Sony Xperia Z2 'high demand' pushes general sale date into May
snippet.description: Sony can't meet demand for its new 4K-shooting flagship phone -- while preorders should go out in April, the general public won't see the Z2 until May.

snippet.title: General Motors President sees self-driving cars by 2020
snippet.description: "I'd be surprised if it didn't happen by then," says GM's Dan Ammann.
